channel.title: What laptop/desktop should I get?
channel.description: Well the laptop I have now is shit and I'm getting $1000 to buy a new one any recommendations? I was looking at [url=http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0034UT0TA?ie=UTF8&tag=procompcom-20&linkCode=as2&camp=1789&creative=390957&creativeASIN=B0034UT0TA]this[/url] but I'm sure there's something better out there.

Tbh don‚Äôt get a laptop for RSPS if you ‚Äú<3‚Äù pking‚Ä¶ Just some advice‚Ä¶ Cuz sometimes the mousepad wont move or some shit and your dead‚Ä¶ Just letting ya know. I have a 2010 laptop which I run my server on and I play it on my desktop cause the damn mousepad -.-

Ever thought of buying a USB mouse‚Ä¶?

item.title: What laptop/desktop should I get?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=‚Äúwhip of soulz, post:21, topic:363383‚Äù][quote author=whip of soulz link=topic=459638.msg3363229#msg3363229 date=1286576563]

get a mac i would have 1 but cant afford‚Ä¶

Ridiculously overpriced if you look at the hardware they really put in them.

Dell are good for gaming, my laptop is a Dell and will play any game I give it (on low-med), and it‚Äôs a laptop, not many will do that.
But, you want to do proper gaming then you‚Äôll need a desktop, couple of months back my mate decided to be better than me and get basically the desktop version of my laptop, here: http://www.dell.com/us/p/studio-xps-8100/pd?oc=dxdonp1&model_id=studio-xps-8100
It‚Äôs kickass, that‚Äôll play Crysis on ultra high settings and 16x anti aliasing, that‚Äôll play literally any game you throw at it no problem, and it comes with a monitor, not bad really.

Thanks might get that specs look sick, is the Intel core i7 processor worth it?
[/quote]FUCK cant get that in uk without paying like ¬£1000 which is probably around ¬£200 more Dell fuking sucks[/quote]

I‚Äôm actually in the UK, I just gave him the american link cause he said dollars.
My friend got it for ¬£779 I think, just under 800 anyway, but he bought the monitor separately, doesn‚Äôt come with it on the UK site, strange‚Ä¶ :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: What laptop/desktop should I get?
item.dc:creator: @i_have_an_ax i have an ax
item.description:
@i_have_an_ax wrote:

noobs are ftw:

get a mac i would have 1 but cant afford‚Ä¶

Honestly, if you‚Äôre just using your computer for gaming, then no, mac isn‚Äôt worth it. I couldn‚Äôt really tell you about the new ones, since I have an older one, but generally speaking, PCs are a much better value for gaming. It‚Äôs nice that Steam is Mac-usable now, but not many of the games are currently Mac-enabled and you‚Äôd need Crossover software for other non-Steam games.

Read full topic

item.title: What laptop/desktop should I get?
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Nah. You don‚Äôt need that.

Build it yourself and make sure you buy all the parts from asians. Asians are typically higher quality, almost half the price and they do better warranties etc.

I bought my computer

Which is

1TB HDD
Rewrite Disc Drive
6Gb of Ram
AMD equiv of i7 processor
512MB Graphics card

For NZ$850.

Which was like 500$USD at the most.

It plays everything‚Ä¶

Not quite at max because the graphics card isn‚Äôt too amazing. But with the 500$USD you would have left over you could buy the gruntiest graphics card in the world

Read full topic

get a mac i would have 1 but cant afford‚Ä¶
[/quote]

Ridiculously overpriced if you look at the hardware they really put in them.

Dell are good for gaming, my laptop is a Dell and will play any game I give it (on low-med), and it‚Äôs a laptop, not many will do that.
But, you want to do proper gaming then you‚Äôll need a desktop, couple of months back my mate decided to be better than me and get basically the desktop version of my laptop, here: http://www.dell.com/us/p/studio-xps-8100/pd?oc=dxdonp1&model_id=studio-xps-8100
It‚Äôs kickass, that‚Äôll play Crysis on ultra high settings and 16x anti aliasing, that‚Äôll play literally any game you throw at it no problem, and it comes with a monitor, not bad really.[/quote]
Thanks might get that specs look sick, is the Intel core i7 processor worth it?

Dell are good for gaming, my laptop is a Dell and will play any game I give it (on low-med), and it‚Äôs a laptop, not many will do that.
But, you want to do proper gaming then you‚Äôll need a desktop, couple of months back my mate decided to be better than me and get basically the desktop version of my laptop, here: http://www.dell.com/us/p/studio-xps-8100/pd?oc=dxdonp1&model_id=studio-xps-8100

item.title: What laptop/desktop should I get?
item.dc:creator: @whip_of_soulz whip of soulz
item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

[quote=‚ÄúSilentCJ, post:12, topic:363383‚Äù][quote author=Phaze One link=topic=459638.msg3362976#msg3362976 date=1286559992]

Generally gaming and I don‚Äôt want a desktop‚Ä¶
[/quote]fair enough but laptops are terrible for gaming & they overheat and turn off on specific games

Not really, my current laptop has never over heated or turned of due to games.

Mine overheated and began to smoke while I was playing Bad Company 2‚Ä¶

Why don‚Äôt you want a desktop? You save yourself a lot of money for what you actually get.
ps. the laptop you chose has a pretty shitty graphics card and wouldn‚Äôt be able to play an awful lot of good games.[/quote]If you can find me a good desktop within my price range, I just want something better than this piece of crap I have now.

Read full topic
